author: Peerzada Ashiq
text:
The killing of a Hizbul Mujahideen militant on Sunday evening in an encounter sparked a shutdown and street protests in south Kashmir’s Kulgam district on Monday.

A police official said Dawood Ahmed Sheikh (21) was killed in a gun battle with security forces at Buchroo hamlet of Kulgam district on Sunday evening.

Sheikh joined the militancy in 2014 and was a member of the Hizb group led by commander Burhan Wani.

Hundreds of residents defied security forces and participated in Sheikh’s funeral. Seven protesters were injured in clashes with forces.
title: Killing of militant sparks protests
